intro: Wahlenbergia longisquamifolia, commonly known as the long-scale forget-me-not, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, blue to violet flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine, scale-like hairs, giving it its specific epithet. Wahlenbergia longisquamifolia is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it thrives in cool, temperate climates.
